content: " President Obama's authorization of Saturday's hostage rescue of Captain Richard Phillips, and the justified killing of three Somali pirates by Navy SEAL sharpshooters, took real courage and was certainly the right decision. Anything less, and his administration would have been second-guessed and the military high command would have been left to wonder what kind of man was leading our nation and our military. A brave American hero's life was at stake, and the president and the Navy made the right decisions. There are, and will be, many things our new president and I will disagree on. But so far, I applaud what he has done regarding our armed services." More at: ***http://www.cnn.com/2009/POLITICS/04/14/rollins.rescue/index.html***
reply: " President Obama's authorization of Saturday's hostage rescue of Captain Richard Phillips, and the justified killing of three Somali pirates by Navy SEAL sharpshooters, took real courage and was certainly the right decision. Anything less, and his administration would have been second-guessed and the military high command would have been left to wonder what kind of man was leading our nation and our military. A brave American hero's life was at stake, and the president and the Navy made the right decisions. There are, and will be, many things our new president and I will disagree on. But so far, I applaud what he has done regarding our armed services." More at: ***http://www.cnn.com/2009/POLITICS/04/14/rollins.rescue/index.html***
title: Ed Rollins: Obama Made Right Call On Rescue

content: I wonder if it will be news everytime the POTUS signs a bill, authorizes a military operation, or in any other way does his J. O. B. Every President before President Obama had to make these type of decisions all of the time and they were not reported on. Based off of the news reporting on this event, you would think the POTUS pulled the trigger himself. I thought "transperancy" meant that we would be able to read bills before they were voted on, not something that is bordering on a "reality show" of the Obama Presidency.
